title: Plate, "Wooden Church", 1919
markings: Marks: On back side: hammer, sickle, cog, 1919 hand-painted in blue overglaze; painter's mark (tree-shaped, for A. Gromov) hand-painted in black overglaze. For Gromov mark see Lobanov-Rostovsky, 1990, p. 154, no. 9.
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Circular plate with wooden church (tower form) painted in center, wide green band around border, edged by thin black lines

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, "Wooden Church", 1919.
1919. porcelain, enamel. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-3.
